cultureNote.title: 한국의 새 학기
cultureNote.description: 🏫 Culture Note: New School Year in Korea. In Korea, the new school year begins in March. Most schools start on March 1st, which is the official start of both the spring semester and new student admissions. This is different from many Western countries where school starts in August or September.For Korean students, March means new classmates, new teachers, and often a new school—just like in this story, where the narrator moves into a dormitory and meets a new roommate.
